Arch Linux.Description: Arch Linux in your browser! Learn more about this amazing operating system on ArchLinux.org

Arch Linux2.Description: Arch Linux in your browser! Learn more about this amazing operating system on ArchLinux.org

Debian.Description: The Universal Operating System. Learn more at Debian.org

SkiftOS.Description: A hobby OS focused on user experience with a beautiful interface. Learn more at SkiftOS.org

Puppy Linux.Description: Extremely lightweight linux distro (with a UI!). Learn more at PuppyLinux.com

Buildroot Linux.Description: Quickly start and test a Buildroot Linux instance directly in your browser.

DSL.Description: Damn Small Linux in your browser! Tiny but powerful OS. Learn more at DamnSmallLinux.org

LineageOS.Description: Run LineageOS, an open source operating system based on Android, in your browser. Learn more at LineageOS.org

Slax.Description: Modern operating system with a clean UI. Reminds me of ChromeOS. Learn more at Slax.org

KNOPPIX.Description: Similar functionality to Slax. Learn more at Knopper.net

Slitaz.Description: Fast, small, and portable operating system. Booted directly from a live CD just like KNOPPIX and Slax. Learn more at Slitaz.org

Kolibri OS.Description: Built with assembly. Runs very fast in the browser relative to other operating systems. Learn more at KolibriOS.org

ReactOS.Description: A Windows compatible operating system. Reverse engineered to work like Windows, run .exe files, and more! Learn more at ReactOS.org
ReactOS.msg: If internet access is not working properly, open/run the 'networking.bat' file on the desktop.

Linux 2.6.Description: Linux 2.6 kernel in your browser! Simple but powerful. Resources: Linux.com and Linux.org

Linux 3.Description: Linux 3 kernel in your browser! Simple but powerful. Resources: Linux.com and Linux.org

Linux 4.Description: Linux 4 kernel in your browser! Simple but powerful. Resources: Linux.com and Linux.org

FreeBSD.Description: Unix-like operating system for servers, desktops, and embedded platforms. Most popular Linux alternative. Learn more at FreeBSD.org

Alpine Linux.Description: Security-oriented, lightweight Linux distro based on musl libc and busybox. Learn more at AlpineLinux.org
Alpine Linux.msg: You may recieve errors in the console upon booting. Alpine Linux will take a while to boot up and after the system automatically retries a few times, you should get past the errors.

Tiny Core Linux.Description: Highly modular operating system with a lightweight graphical desktop environment. Learn more at TinyCoreLinux.net

QNX.Description: Unix-like operating system for embedded systems. Powers a lot of mobile devices. Learn more at QNX.com

SolarOS.Description: Simple graphical and Unix operating system originally developed by Sun Microsystems and acquired by Oracle in 2010. Learn more at oby.ro/os

Minix.Description: Similar to NetBSD. Learn more at Minix3.org

Fedora.Description: Fedora 25 Workstation Live CD. Learn more at GetFedora.org

openSUSE.Description: Great operating system for developers and sysadmins. Learn more at openSUSE.org

NixOS.Description: Reproducible, Declarative, and Reliable Linux Distro. Learn more at NixOS.org

Lakka.Description: Lightweight retrogaming console built on top of Linux. Learn more at Lakka.tv

Linux Mint.Description: Lightweight retrogaming console built on top of Linux. Learn more at Lakka.tv

Ubuntu.Description: Lightweight retrogaming console built on top of Linux. Learn more at Lakka.tv

OberonOS.Description: Complete desktop computer from scratch. Learn more at ProjectOberon.com

Windows XP.Description: Windows XP Professional Edition in your browser. Easily boot into a very iconic, nostalgia-inducing, and beloved operating system.

Windows Vista.Description: It isn't as bad as Windows ME. It is still, however, quite a horrible operating system.

Windows 7.Description: Easily start Windows 7, one of the more well known operating systems on this list.

MSDOS.Description: The Windows command line in your browser.

Windows 1.0.Description: Try out the first Windows graphical operating system.

Windows 3.1.Description: Try out one of the first Windows graphical operating systems.

Windows 95.Description: Travel back to 1995 in one of the earlier Windows releases.
Windows 95.msg: If internet access is not working properly, open/run the 'networking.bat' file on the desktop.

Windows 98.Description: Travel back to 1998 in one of the earlier Windows releases.
Windows 98.msg: If internet access is not working properly, open/run the 'networking.bat' file on the desktop.

Windows 2000.Description: Travel back to 'the turn of the 21st century' in one of the earlier Windows releases.
Windows 2000.msg: If internet access is not working properly, open/run the 'networking.bat' file on the desktop.

Windows ME.Description: Try out one of the most notoriously buggy operating systems in existence. Windows ME or Millenium Edition (or as I like to call it: 'Windows Mistake Edition') is known to be 'one of the worst operating systems of all time'.

Floppy Bird.msg: Press W or SPACE on your keyboard to start the game and control the bird. Press W or SPACE again to restart the game.

Custom.Description: Must be a 32-bit i686 Pentium 3 compatible OS. More configuration is needed for custom VMs below.
